arguments.argument: Same-sex couples deserve the same legal rights as heterosexual couples.
Marriage equality is a fundamental civil right.
Denying same-sex marriage is a form of discrimination.
Legal protections ensure that LGBTQ+ families are treated equally under the law.
Most Americans support marriage equality, reflecting changing social values.
Same-sex marriage bans have historically caused harm to LGBTQ+ individuals.
Denying marriage equality goes against the principle of separation of church and state.
Marriage provides legal benefits such as inheritance and healthcare rights.
Federally protecting same-sex marriage prevents discrimination at the state level.
Equality under the law strengthens democracy and social progress.
Marriage should be defined as between a man and a woman.
Same-sex marriage contradicts religious beliefs held by many Americans.
The government should not interfere in defining marriage.
States should have the right to decide marriage laws individually.
Legalizing same-sex marriage could lead to future changes in marriage laws.
Religious organizations may be forced to recognize same-sex marriages.
Traditional marriage has been a cornerstone of society for centuries.
Marriage equality could conflict with parental rights in religious households.
Some people believe same-sex marriage could weaken the institution of marriage.
Protecting same-sex marriage at the federal level is unnecessary given existing laws.
